member.name: T:Tenor.Mobile.UI.NotificationWithSoftKeys
member.summary:
Implements Windows CE functionality for displaying and responding to user notifications.
New in v1.3
member.remarks:
This class provides a managed implementation of the Windows CE notification functions. This class is supported only on the Pocket PC.
You can create notifications and then display them as needed using the property. The property sets the time the message balloon initially displays. If you set to zero and Visible to true, the message balloon does not appear but its icon is available in the title bar for reactivation when clicked. The event occurs whenever the balloon is shown or hidden, either programmatically using the property or through user interaction. In addition to plain text, you can create a user notification with HTML content in the message balloon. The HTML is rendered by the Pocket PC HTML control, and you can respond to values in an HTML form by parsing a response string provided by the class, through the property. Cmd:2 Identifier
The identifier "cmd:2" has a special purpose in Windows CE and is used to dismiss notifications. If cmd:2 is the name of an HTML button or other element in a message balloon, the event is not raised. The notification is dismissed, but its icon is placed on the title bar to be responded to at a later time.

member.name: M:Tenor.Mobile.UI.NotificationWithSoftKeys.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This class is not supported on the Smartphone or other Windows CE devices that are not Pocket PCs. You can create multiple notifications, such as an array of notifications, and display them as needed with the Visible property.

member.name: P:Tenor.Mobile.UI.NotificationWithSoftKeys.NotificationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the guid used to managed the notification event.

member.name: P:Tenor.Mobile.UI.NotificationWithSoftKeys.Caption
member.summary: Gets or sets a string specifying the title text for the message balloon.
member.value: A string that specifies the caption text. The default value is an empty string ("").
member.remarks: The background color of the caption is dependent on the current theme of the user. Use the property to modify the text in the body of the message balloon.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the message balloon remains visible after initially shown.
member.remarks: The amount of time the balloon is visible, in seconds. The default is 10.

member.name: T:Tenor.Mobile.NativeMethods.IMessageFilter
member.summary: Defines a message filter interface.
member.remarks:
This interface allows an application to capture a message before it is dispatched to a control or form.
A class that implements the IMessageFilter interface can be added to the application's message pump to filter out a message or perform other operations before the message is dispatched to a form or control. To add the message filter to an application's message pump, use the method in the class.

member.name: M:Tenor.Mobile.NativeMethods.IMessageFilter.PreFilterMessage(Microsoft.WindowsCE.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Filters out a message before it is dispatched.
member.param: The message to be dispatched. You cannot modify this message.
member.returns: true to filter the message and stop it from being dispatched; false to allow the message to continue to the next filter or control.

member.name: M:Tenor.Mobile.Location.Gps.Gps.GetPosition(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Get the position reported by the GPS receiver that is no older than the maxAge passed in
member.param: Max age of the gps position data that you want back. If there is no data within the required age, null is returned. if maxAge == TimeSpan.Zero, then the age of the data is ignored
member.returns: GpsPosition class with all the position details
